meanings.definition: The quality or state of being easily distracted.
meanings.sent1: Her distractibility in class often led to missing important information.
meanings.sent2: His distractibility made it challenging for him to finish his homework on time.
meanings.sent3: The distractibility of the puppy was adorable as it chased after every leaf that moved.
meanings.sent4: The distractibility of the toddler was like a magnet to every passing butterfly.
meanings.sent5: The distractibility of the squirrel was so extreme that it forgot where it hid its nuts.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be easily diverted from a task or focus.
meanings.sent1: The distractibility of the students during the movie showed their lack of interest.
meanings.sent2: His distractibility at work often resulted in incomplete projects.
meanings.sent3: The distractibility of the cat was evident as it chased shadows on the wall.
meanings.sent4: Her distractibility in the library was like a bee flitting from flower to flower.
meanings.sent5: The distractibility of the driver caused him to miss the turn for his destination.
